Wayfinder SDKs
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sCopy MarkdownOpenWayfinder leverages the decentralized AR.IO Network to provide robust, censorship-resistant access to data stored on Arweave, removing reliance on centralized gateways. By routing requests through a distributed set of community-operated gateways, Wayfinder ensures high availability, redundancy, and improved performance for users and applications. The ar:

pages.title: Wayfinder Core
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreCopy MarkdownOpenBuilding for the web? Consider using @ar.io/wayfinder-react for React applications, which provides hooks and components optimized for browser environments. Quick Start Installnpmpnpmyarnbunnpm install @ar.io/wayfinder-core @ar.io/sdkImport and configureimport { createWayfinderClient } from '@ar.io/wayfinder-core'; import { ARIO } from '@ar.io/sdk';

pages.title: Dynamic Routing
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreDynamic RoutingCopy MarkdownOpenWayfinder supports a resolveUrl method which generates dynamic redirect URLs to a target gateway based on the provided routing strategy. This function can be used to directly replace any hard-coded gateway URLs, and instead use Wayfinder's routing logic to select a gateway for the request. ArNS names Given an ArNS name, the redirect URL will be the same as the original URL, but with the gateway selected by Wayfinder's routing strategy.

pages.title: Telemetry
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreTelemetryCopy MarkdownOpenWayfinder can optionally emit OpenTelemetry spans for every request. By default, telemetry is disabled. You can control this behavior with the telemetrySettings option. import { createWayfinderClient } from '@ar.io/wayfinder-core'; import { ARIO } from '@ar.io/sdk'; How is this guide?GoodBadDirect Constructor UsageJavaScript/TypeScript SDK for accessing Arweave data with built-in verification and gateway routingRequest FlowJavaScript/TypeScript SDK for accessing Arweave data with built-in verification and gateway routing

pages.title: Request Flow
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreRequest FlowCopy MarkdownOpenThe following sequence diagram illustrates how Wayfinder processes requests: How is this guide?GoodBadTelemetryJavaScript/TypeScript SDK for accessing Arweave data with built-in verification and gateway routingWayfinder ReactReact hooks and components for integrating Wayfinder into React applications

pages.title: Direct Constructor Usage
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreAdvanced UsageDirect Constructor UsageCopy MarkdownOpenFor complete control, you can use the Wayfinder constructor directly. This is useful when you need fine-grained control over the configuration: Wayfinder client that caches the top 10 gateways by operator stake from the ARIO Network for 1 hour and uses the fastest pinging routing strategy to select the fastest gateway for requests. import { Wayfinder, NetworkGatewaysProvider, SimpleCacheGatewaysProvider, FastestPingRoutingStrategy, HashVerificationStrategy } from '@ar.io/wayfinder-core'; import { ARIO } from '@ar.io/sdk'; }, onRoutingSkipped: (event) , onRoutingSucceeded: (event) , }, },

pages.title: NetworkGatewaysProvider
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreGateway ProvidersNetworkGatewaysProviderCopy MarkdownOpenReturns a list of gateways from the ARIO Network based on on-chain metrics. You can specify on-chain metrics for gateways to prioritize the highest quality gateways. This requires installing the @ar.io/sdk package and importing the ARIO object. It is recommended to use this provider for most use cases to leverage the AR.IO Network.

pages.title: Global request events
pages.content: Wayfinder SDK'sWayfinder CoreMonitoring and EventsGlobal request eventsCopy MarkdownOpenWayfinder emits events during the routing and verification process for all requests, allowing you to monitor its operation. All events are emitted on the wayfinder.emitter event emitter, and are updated for each request.
